summary: This isn't the sort of art I normally do, but I wanted a way to thank Taliesin for getting me into The Wicked and The Divine,...
body:
This isn’t the sort of art I normally do, but I wanted a way to thank Taliesin for getting me into The Wicked and The Divine, and I remembered seeing people talking about how Molly was like a WicDiv god and this idea sprang from there!

I’m already so floored by the response this has had on twitter, this fandom is amazing 💜

reblog.comment:

summary: Liam was way too nit-picky about that second Slow.
title: Liam was way too nit-picky about that second Slow.
body:
First off, he said “exactly as before” when he cast it.  That implies same targets.

Second, players don’t decide which DM roll is for which NPC.  Trying to grab the low D20 result by manipulating target choice is a cheap tactic.

reblog.comment:
First off, he said “exactly as before” when he cast it.  That implies same targets.

Second, players don’t decide which DM roll is for which NPC.  Trying to grab the low D20 result by manipulating target choice is a cheap tactic.

trail.content_raw:
First off, he said “exactly as before” when he cast it.  That implies same targets.

Second, players don’t decide which DM roll is for which NPC.  Trying to grab the low D20 result by manipulating target choice is a cheap tactic.
trail.content:
First off, he said “exactly as before” when he cast it.  That implies same targets.

Second, players don’t decide which DM roll is for which NPC.  Trying to grab the low D20 result by manipulating target choice is a cheap tactic.

summary: Probably 5 people besides me will care about this but this MADE MY DAY so -  Kieron Gillen, my favorite comic book writer and...
body:
Probably 5 people besides me will care about this but this MADE MY DAY so - 

Kieron Gillen, my favorite comic book writer and the author of “The Wicked + the Divine,” (along with McKelvie, Wilson, and Cowles) probably my favorite comic of all time, just retweeted this amazing Mollymauk/WicDiv crossover fanart:

What’s extra amazing is that Taliesin is a huge WicDiv fan too, to the point where a deluxe edition of the comic was one of the Personal Items Liam added to his character sheet all the way back in the original “Liam’s Quest” oneshot. I hope he sees this!

reblog.comment:

summary: you know when you see an actor you recognize but you don’t know where from? well, I had that the other day, in my history of the...
body:
you know when you see an actor you recognize but you don’t know where from? well, I had that the other day, in my history of the moving image class. we were discussing sound and editing and the teacher pulled up a clip of Magic Mike (it was actually quite a cute scene, and I had never watched any other part of the movie so it was not really all that awkward to watch a part of that movie in the class, but I digress). but there is this acter I recognize and I cannot place him, he’s dancing to the backstreet boys and I'm just like “who is this man??? why does he look so familiar???” 

then it hits me. he’s Joe Manganiello, JOCKS MACHINA. I know this man only as a Dragonborn paladin who stole the Hand of Vecna, and now is dancing seductively in a convince store. So in conclusion, the main thing that I took from that class is that there is a huge DnD nerd in a Magic Mike movie.

reblog.comment:

then it hits me. he’s Joe Manganiello, JOCKS MACHINA. I know this man only as a Dragonborn paladin who stole the Hand of Vecna, and now is dancing seductively in a convince store. So in conclusion, the main thing that I took from that class is that there is a huge DnD nerd in a Magic Mike movie.

then it hits me. he’s Joe Manganiello, JOCKS MACHINA. I know this man only as a Dragonborn paladin who stole the Hand of Vecna, and now is dancing seductively in a convince store. So in conclusion, the main thing that I took from that class is that there is a huge DnD nerd in a Magic Mike movie.
trail.content:
you know when you see an actor you recognize but you don’t know where from? well, I had that the other day, in my history of the moving image class. we were discussing sound and editing and the teacher pulled up a clip of Magic Mike (it was actually quite a cute scene, and I had never watched any other part of the movie so it was not really all that awkward to watch a part of that movie in the class, but I digress). but there is this acter I recognize and I cannot place him, he’s dancing to the backstreet boys and I'm just like “who is this man??? why does he look so familiar???” 

then it hits me. he’s Joe Manganiello, JOCKS MACHINA. I know this man only as a Dragonborn paladin who stole the Hand of Vecna, and now is dancing seductively in a convince store. So in conclusion, the main thing that I took from that class is that there is a huge DnD nerd in a Magic Mike movie.

blog.name: we-are-rogue
blog.title: we are Rogue
blog.description:
Gallery | D&D | Fiction | Theory | Practice | Iconic | Tags and Masterposts

Inspiration and resources for Rogues, the most resourceful player class and fantasy archetype of them all.

Jacks of all trades and masters of none, thieves, outlaws, rascals, scoundrels, pickpockets, cutpurses, cat burglars, bandits, con artists, assassins, infiltrators, highwaymen, spies, swashbucklers, smugglers, pirates, thugs, jesters, tricksters, skillmonkeys, specialists, factotums, and the occasional ronin: we are ROGUE.

summary: Progress so far on my Nott painting! The green paint wasn’t working like it should so it’s a little messy. I’m going to need to...
caption: Progress so far on my Nott painting! The green paint wasn’t working like it should so it’s a little messy. I’m going to need to buy more in the future. And I’ll need to make sure my yellow and white paints are thick enough for her pointy-outy teeth.
